Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Inventory extends Object implements Serializable
The Inventory class represents the player's inventory, containing items, a current pet, locked pets, and the player's score. It provides methods to manage the inventory, current pet, and score, as well as to use items in the inventory to affect the pet's hunger and happiness.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory(String current, double gameScore)
      Constructs an Inventory object with a given current pet and initial game score. The inventory is initialized with 6 items, and the locked pets array is set up.
      Parameters:
      current - The name of the current pet.
      gameScore - The starting score of the player.

  • Method Details

    • setCurrentPet

      public void setCurrentPet(String current)
      Sets the current pet of the player.
      Parameters:
      current - The name of the new current pet.

    • getCurrentPet

      public String getCurrentPet()
      Returns the name of the current pet.
      Returns:
      The name of the current pet.

    • getScore

      public double getScore()
      Returns the current score of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's score.

    • setScore

      public void setScore(double scoreNew)
      Sets the player's score to a new value.
      Parameters:
      scoreNew - The new score to set.

    • getLockedPets

      public boolean[] getLockedPets()
      Returns an array indicating the locked status of pets.
      Returns:
      An array of boolean values, where each element represents whether the corresponding pet is locked.

    • setLockedPets

      public void setLockedPets(boolean[] lockedPets)
      Sets the locked status of pets to a new array of values.
      Parameters:
      lockedPets - An array of boolean values representing the new locked status of the pets.

    • getInventory

      public Item[] getInventory()
      Returns the array of items in the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      An array of Item objects representing the inventory.

    • setInventory

      public void setInventory(Item[] inventoryNew)
      Sets the inventory to a new array of items.
      Parameters:
      inventoryNew - An array of Item objects representing the new inventory.

    • useItem

      public double[] useItem(int itemIndex)
      Uses an item from the inventory based on its index. The item is used by decreasing its quantity. The method also returns the hunger and happiness bonuses associated with using the item. Indexes: 0 - Orange, 1 - Popsicle, 2 - Cake, 3 - Cards, 4 - Ball, 5 - Gift
      Parameters:
      itemIndex - The index of the item to use.
      Returns:
      An array containing the hunger bonus at index 0 and the happiness bonus at index 1.
